text:
Would somebody else be interested in a "wrap bounty"?
If you wrap a certain C/C++/other library and expose the relevant features to Julia and tie it in with the ecosystem (specs are made beforehand) you get paid a price by people who were interested in that wrapper existing. Money is held in escrow in the meantime by *shruggs* (probably some platform like <https://gitpay.me>, <https://issuehunt.io/>, BountySource (supposedly turned evil) ... ).

attachments.text: IssueHunt :owl: = OSS Development :hammer_and_pick: + Bounty Program :moneybag:. IssueHunt is an issue-based bounty platform for open source projects. Anyone can put a bounty on not only a bug but also on OSS feature requests listed on IssueHunt. Collected funds will be distributed to project owners and contributors.

text:
Yeah but i suspect people would rather pay 10% in credit card fees and overhead than bother with crypto currencies. Tax stuff might be a nightmare ... volatility is high ...
A blockchain is no more an guarantee than supposed money in someones account is. Both can decide not to pay out for any reason. No difference to money at all. Smart contracts are not working either since we need a human in the loop to verify that the port was proper.
I couldn't use blockchain in my country without holding it for a year (or paying lot's of taxes on it) as an anti speculation messure.
I really wouldn't want this idea tainted with block chain. No matter how superficially appealing it sounds in this case it doesn't work and in addition blockhain causes a lot of drama.
On the blockchain issue I always feel compelled to share this piece: <https://thecorrespondent.com/655/blockchain-the-amazing-solution-for-almost-nothing/86649455475-f933fe63>

attachments.title: Blockchain, the amazing solution for almost nothing
attachments.text: Blockchain technology is going to change everything: the shipping industry, the financial system, government … in fact, what won’t it change? But enthusiasm for it mainly stems from a lack of knowledge and understanding. The blockchain is a solution in search of a problem.
